title: Understanding Research Objectives
text: A research objective is a clear, concise statement that outlines the goals or aims of a research study. It describes what the researcher intends to achieve by conducting the study.

title: Understanding Hypotheses
text: A hypothesis is a testable prediction about the relationship between two or more variables. It is often formulated as a statement that can be supported or refuted through experimentation or observation.

hintAnswer: A research objective outlines the goals of the study, while a hypothesis is a testable prediction about the relationship between variables.
title: Distinguishing Features
text: What distinguishes a research objective from a hypothesis in a research study?
choices: A research objective is a testable prediction
A hypothesis outlines the goals of the study
A research objective outlines the goals of the study, while a hypothesis is a testable prediction about the relationship between variables
A hypothesis is a broad statement of intent
